This explains his near 0% pick/ban rate in competitive this split (I put in the "near" just in case, but I honestly can't think of a single game I've seen him in).  Everyone who ever said "no matter the numbers, Thresh's kit is overloaded and he will always be OP" should be lining up to apologize to Riot and admit they were wrong, but instead they're here in this thread saying that a champion even Aphromoo can't make effective is "perfectly balanced".

Thresh is being buffed because he doesn't do as much for your team as most support champions you could pick.  Partly because there is no mastery this season that fits his kit, partly because none of the support items really fit him well (enjoy spending all your flay charges trying to last hit with a half-functioning relic shield?  No?  Then have a coin that's lost the MS that was actually really good for him) and partly because one of the main unique things he did, bring allies across walls even if they have no wallhop of their own, Bard does better while also being a healer, dealing more damage and having an ult that not only doesn't require committing suicide, it can actually make plays from way outside Thresh's range.
